abstract: Rio Tinto said it had yet to be presented with any evidence to support the detention of four of its China-based staff on suspicions of stealing state secrets.
snippet: Rio Tinto said it had yet to be presented with any evidence to support the detention of four of its China-based staff on suspicions of stealing state secrets.
lead_paragraph: Rio Tinto said Tuesday it had yet to be presented with any evidence to support the detention of four of its China-based staff on suspicions of stealing state secrets, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Rio Tinto Says China Hasn’t Backed Up Allegations

abstract: The workers face charges of commercial bribery and trade secrets infringement, but more serious charges of espionage were not mentioned.
snippet: The workers face charges of commercial bribery and trade secrets infringement, but more serious charges of espionage were not mentioned.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  China formally charged an Australian citizen and three other employees of the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto late Tuesday with commercial bribery and trade secrets infringement in a case that has rocked the global steel industry and created a diplomatic uproar.

headline.main: China Charges 4 Rio Tinto Employees; Spying Allegations Are Dropped
headline.print_headline: China Charges 4 Employees of Rio Tinto, but Backs Off Allegations of Spying
